Class SolverUsagesTest

java.lang.Object
SolverUsagesTest
public class SolverUsagesTest
extends java.lang.Object
Test class for the Solver Usages. This class can provide some help to use the SatSolver.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int[][] cnf
    a rule set with known truth table, described in setUp() Method
    private int[][] determinedInCircle
    a rule set which describes a circle with conclusions
    private int[][] fourEqualVarsInIt
    a rule set where four logical equal variables exist
    private int[][] noEqualsInIt
    a rule set where no logical equal variables exist
    private SatSolver satSolver
    The Sat Solver used to provide the Usages a boolean satisfiability Solver
    private int[][] threeEqualVarsInIt
    a rule set where three logical equal variables exist
    private int[][] twoEqualVarsInIt
    a rule set where two logical equal variables exist

  • Constructor Details

    • SolverUsagesTest

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      @BeforeEach public void setUp() throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      The setUp Method creates the cnf and adding it as rule set to the Sat Solver. Also, some rule sets created here for testing the Solver Usage Methods
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - is needed because we're adding new rules. By adding the rule, the rule set turns into a contradiction. See: Sat4J documentation

    • isLogicalConclusion

      @Test public void isLogicalConclusion() throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException, org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Test some conclusions using rule sets with logical consequences and equality in it. To test for not a logical conclusion we create a new independent variable.
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if the calculation takes too much time. See: Sat4J documentation
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - If the rules are a contradiction. See: Sat4J documentation

    • isHardConclusion

      @Test public void isHardConclusion() throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException, org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Test some conclusions using rule sets with logical consequences and equality in it. We used the same procedure as in isLogicalConclusion() but marked the conclusion that a not hard as false. For example in this.determinedInCircle every variable is always true, so there are no hard conclusion in this rule set.
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if the calculation takes too much time. See: Sat4J documentation
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - If the rules are a contradiction. See: Sat4J documentation

    • alreadyDeterminedVars

      @Test public void alreadyDeterminedVars() throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException, org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Tests the already determined Vars in the rule sets. We test some easy ways, where the determined variables are alone in a rule, like in this.cnf where 2 is alone in a rule marked as always true. Also, we test a circle of determinism where 1 is marked as true and other variables logically consequences on this. As well as rule sets where no determined variables exist.
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if the calculation takes too much time. See: Sat4J documentation
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - If the rules are a contradiction. See: Sat4J documentation

    • findEqualVars

      @Test public void findEqualVars() throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException, org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Testing the search of Equal Vars in a rule set. We define some rule sets with different amount of equal vars in it by adding rules like a -> b and b -> a which means that they are logically equal.
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if the calculation takes too much time. See: Sat4J documentation
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - If the rules are a contradiction. See: Sat4J documentation
